page.title: 02ALFRICK CHURCH
page.content: St.Mary Magdalene Church in Alfrick, was built in the late 12th.Century. The walls are made of rubble stone,the roof is tiled.The belfry has a timber frame and is covered with wooden shingles.There is a sundial on the south side.There are Norman windows in the south,west and north walls. There are severalstained glass windows some Victorian, others recent. Inside the church there is a very simple Norman font.On a wall in the Lady Chapel is a fragment of a Norman sculpture showing a woman.Also in the Lady Chapel is a Jacobean altar rail. Some old grave-stones have been used in the floor.The timber roof beams date from the 15th.Century. In 1885 a transept and vestry were added,designed by Aston Webb.
